radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete right bundle branch block (CRBBB) and normal QT interval (QTc, 435 ms) before cisapride; severe bradycardia with prolonged QT interval (QTc, 480 ms) and repetitive torsade de pointes (TdP) on admission; QT prolongation exaggerated by pacing (QTc, 731 ms); normalized QT interval (QTc, 417 ms) after 6 days drug-free.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked QT prolongation observed during pacing, shortened the next day after withdrawal of drugs, and QT interval was normalized at the sixth day.
